Have an early (low-fidelity/paper) prototype (of product or service)	6	Yes	Increasing	No	Yes	https://inbalance.ai/ https://www.instagram.com/inbalance.ai/	https://drive.google.com/file/d/1MtX52oip86XO46xbbAGAYRaWqSr063XY/view?usp=drive_link	Millions of women suffer from Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS) and hormonal imbalances, yet misdiagnoses, delayed treatments, and a lack of personalized care remain major obstacles. The average time to diagnose PCOS is over two years, and many women are prescribed generic pills that fail to address the root cause of their condition.   I identified this issue through my own struggle with PCOS and the frustration of receiving incomplete or ineffective treatments. But beyond my personal experience, I noticed a critical lack of awareness among women‚Äîevery time I spoke with girls experiencing irregular cycles, they knew something was wrong, but they didn‚Äôt have the knowledge or the right medical guidance to understand their hormonal health. Many didn‚Äôt even know the term PCOS.   Shockingly, this wasn‚Äôt just the case in Lebanon‚Äîit was the same in France during my master‚Äôs studies. Even in developed healthcare systems, women are left navigating their hormonal imbalances without proper education or solutions. This global gap in awareness and healthcare accessibility inspired me to build Inbalance‚Äîa platform that ensures women receive the knowledge, diagnosis, and treatment they truly deserve.	Inbalance is an AI-powered health platform that helps women easily track, diagnose, and manage hormonal imbalances such as PCOS, and  thyroid disorders.  Millions of women struggle with hormonal issues, yet 60% remain undiagnosed or misdiagnosed, and it takes an average of 4-6 years to receive proper care. Many are given generic treatments like birth control, which fail to address the root cause. At Inbalance, we simplify women‚Äôs healthcare by providing:  üîπ AI-driven diagnosis & personalized treatment plans ‚Äì Our smart system analyzes medical history, symptoms, menstrual cycles, and lifestyle factors to provide 95% accurate diagnoses and tailored health recommendations.   üîπ Easy health tracking through text and image ‚Äì Users can track their symptoms, periods, mood, and physical changes by simply entering text descriptions or uploading images (e.g., skin conditions, weight changes). Our AI analyzes this data to detect patterns and provide insights.   üîπ Expert-guided care ‚Äì Women get direct access to endocrinologists, gynecologists, nutritionists, and mental health professionals, ensuring they receive the right care beyond generic medications.   üîπ A supportive community ‚Äì Our platform offers a safe space for women to share experiences, get advice, and stay motivated on their health journey.   By combining AI technology, expert medical support, and seamless health tracking through text and image, Inbalance empowers women to take control of their hormonal health with ease and get the care they truly deserve. Beaver Ed is designed to address the needs of all stakeholders‚Äîoffering an effortless yet impactful solution that transforms learning into a more engaging, effective, and future-proof experience. Mixing hands-on and online learning for a better education, Beaver Ed is a construction educational kit designed for schools to help students understand and manually explore the scientific and mathematical concepts they learn in class. The kit aims to promote pure, raw creativity using simple construction materials: wooden bars. Additionally, it provides access to an educational program and a gamified experience that blends real-world applications with digital fun. Our goal is to empower kids to discover and believe in their unique strengths and to guide education towards problem-solving, teamwork, creativity, divergent thinking, and the acceptance of diverse perspectives.  The Beaver physical kit is a hands-on construction tool that includes 50 cm wooden sticks, a safe cutter that allows customizable cuts, and different types of recycled plastic joints for 90-degree and multi-angle connections and rotations. The kit also features a rope for creating mechanisms like cranks, pivoting joints, or even wooden gears, allowing students to construct various structures. We call this 'raw creativity.'    As for schools enrolled in the Beaver Educational Program, each year, the students will receive a kit and participate in monthly challenges via our educational platform. These challenges require students to apply classroom theories in real-world scenarios using our kit. Our curriculum is customized for each school and program, ensuring alignment with their theoretical curriculum. For example, rather than simply drawing a 4 cm line, students might be tasked with connecting two desks by building a bridge. They would measure the distance and cut wooden pieces to the correct length. Challenges start with simple tasks and progress to advanced applications of physics and math concepts. For instance, students may be challenged to construct a crane, considering factors like momentum, range of motion, and weight support.  After each challenge, the Beaver team reviews submissions, providing feedback to students and teachers on both academic and non-graded skills, like creativity, to highlight each student‚Äôs unique strengths.    Additionally, we offer a gamified approach to these challenges. In collaboration with online education platforms like Synthesis, which use digital games for learning, Beaver can be integrated into these digital environments. When a character in the game encounters an obstacle, students can construct a physical solution with the Beaver kit, then scan their structure to appear on screen for their character to use. For instance, if the character needs to climb a wall, students build a ladder, scan it, and their character can then climb it. Students can build various structures to assist their character‚Äîlike bridges, catapults, planes, or boats‚Äîblending hands-on creativity with digital learning.
